intro: Fugosia, commonly known as the glassworts, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaranthaceae. These plants are typically found in saline or coastal environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. They are characterized by their succulent, often fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. Fugosia species are known for their ability to accumulate salt, which helps them thrive in areas with high salinity. Their unique botanical features make them important in ecological studies and horticultural practices.
